intro: Coronilla somalensis, commonly known as the Somali crownvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It is a legume belonging to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its trifoliate leaves and pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to harsh conditions. It has small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its drought tolerance, it is sometimes used for soil stabilization in degraded landscapes.
